title: Warehouses
description: Ozonation of warehouse facilities protects goods from mold and fungus, controls pests, extends product shelf life and creates a healthy air environment for staff.

mold-prevention.title: Mold and fungus control
mold-prevention.shortDesc: Suppressing mold growth and eliminating contamination hotspots in the warehouse
mold-prevention.content:
Uncontrolled mold growth in warehouse facilities leads to product spoilage and poor employee health. Mold spores and toxins in the air undermine staff immunity, while spoilage of goods and cardboard increases waste.

Warehouse ozonation addresses the problem comprehensively: it destroys existing contamination hotspots, suppresses new mold and fungus colonies, eliminates unpleasant odors from microbial activity.

Ozone interacts with the membrane structure of bacterial and fungal cells, disrupting their barrier function and causing cell death. Unlike chemical agents, the gas penetrates all crevices and remote corners, treating hard-to-reach areas.

For effective mold control, ozonation is recommended for 1–3 hours during off-hours. Ozone generator capacity is selected at approximately 1 g/h per 25 m³ of room volume.

general-storage.title: General goods storage
general-storage.shortDesc: Maintaining stored product quality and warehouse sanitary conditions
general-storage.content:
Warehouse logistics requires stable storage conditions to preserve a wide range of goods. Air ozonation comprehensively addresses disinfection, deodorization and spoilage prevention.

Regular ozonation reduces bacterial load in the air and on surfaces, extends product shelf life, eliminates unpleasant odors and creates comfortable conditions for staff.

The technology is especially relevant for mixed-purpose warehouses, distribution centers and logistics hubs storing diverse product groups with different storage requirements.

Ozone is universal: equally effective against bacteria, viruses, fungi and pests. Treatment does not require unloading and can be run automatically on a timer.

intro.paragraph1: Modern warehouse logistics requires a comprehensive approach to maintaining stored goods quality. Air ozonation is a universal technology that simultaneously addresses disinfection, deodorization, pest control and spoilage prevention.
intro.paragraph2: For logistics operators and warehouse facility owners, ozonation becomes a quality standard that reduces losses, extends product shelf life and ensures compliance with sanitary requirements without constant use of chemical agents.
intro.infoText: Ozonation is treatment of large air volumes without unloading goods. The gas penetrates all warehouse zones, including hard-to-reach areas between pallets and on upper rack tiers.

warehouseTypes.title: Warehouse types and recommended solutions
warehouseTypes.paragraph: Ozonation approach varies depending on warehouse facility type, stored products and turnover intensity.

calculation.title: Coverage calculation for large spaces
calculation.paragraph: For effective treatment of warehouses from 1000 m², it is necessary to consider not only room volume, but also ceiling height, presence of racks, air exchange intensity and type of stored goods.
calculation.exampleText: Warehouse 3000 m² × 8 m height = 24000 m³. Base capacity: 24000÷25 = 960 g/h. With racks (×1.3): 1248 g/h. Installation of 4–5 ozone generators of 250–300 g/h each or integration into ventilation system is recommended.

hvacIntegration.title: Integration with ventilation system (HVAC)
hvacIntegration.paragraph: For large logistics complexes, optimal solution is integration of ozone equipment into existing ventilation and air conditioning system.
numberedItems: Duct ozone generator installed in supply or recirculation duct
Ozone concentration sensor monitors level in work zone
Automation controls modes: preventive (low doses) and intensive (off-hours)
Integration with BMS (Building Management System) for centralized control
Ozone destructor at ventilation outlet when discharging to atmosphere
bulletItems: Even ozone distribution throughout warehouse volume

frequency.title: Treatment frequency and optimal schedule
frequency.paragraph: Ozonation regularity depends on warehouse type, turnover intensity and storage quality requirements. For most warehouses, 2–4 treatments per week during off-hours is sufficient.
frequency.scheduleText: Ozonation is recommended during night hours (22:00 — 06:00). With properly selected treatment time, ozone will fully dissipate by start of workday without need for special ventilation.

pestPrevention.title: Pest prevention
pestPrevention.paragraph1: Ozone is effective against a wide range of warehouse pests: insects, rodents, mites. Regular treatment creates unfavorable environment for their habitation and reproduction.
pestPrevention.paragraph2: When pests are detected, ozonation is used as part of disinfestation measures. Ozone does not replace professional treatment for severe infestation, but is effective for prevention and maintenance treatments.

airQuality.title: Air quality for staff
airQuality.paragraph: Ozonation improves working conditions for warehouse workers: eliminates musty odors, reduces dust and allergen concentration, destroys pathogenic microorganisms in air.
airQuality.warningText: MPC of ozone in work zone — 0.1 mg/m³. Treatment is conducted in absence of people. Staff performing maintenance during ozonation must use respirator or gas mask with carbon filter.

compliance.title: Compliance with storage requirements
compliance.paragraph: Ozonation helps comply with sanitary requirements for warehouse facilities of various classes. Ozone leaves no chemical residues on goods and is compatible with most materials.
bulletItems: Certification requirements for pharmaceutical and food warehouses

economics.title: Implementation economics
economics.paragraph1: Investment in ozonation pays off through reduced losses, savings on chemical treatment and improved staff health indicators.
economics.paragraph2: * Including equipment depreciation, electricity and maintenance. Net savings: about 330,000 ₽/year. Equipment payback period: 8–14 months.
